intro: Teucrium commune var. purpurascens, commonly known as purple germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring aromatic, gray-green leaves with a distinctive purplish tinge on the underside. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and herbal medicine.
